Half-Life 2 is a continuation of Half-Life Games (Half-Life, Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life: Opposing Forces, etc). Half-Life 2 drastically develops the story of the Half-Life Universe, showing Earth after the Black Mesa Incident. The game focuses more on the story than the previous game, but never failed to surprise the game industry. The game had revolutionized the creation of games, just as the first Half-Life had done it had brought new game mechanics to the game and made many adjustments and upgrades from the original Half-Life. This game is notoriously acclaimed and for good reason, I suggest a full buy of this game series, as it's a good buy even 2 decades later.

C A P O L A V O R O
AWESOME GAME! I'M STILL PLAYING IN 2020
Still a great game in 2020. Enjoyable storyline and soundtrack.

Ok listen, this game has costed a dollar to purchase for the past 3-4 years on the major sales.  IF you have any passing interest in the first game or the second game or the expansions for either of them, then grab them.

With that out of the way, I'll make my personal thoughts as brief as possible.  My experience with this game was all over the place.  Technically, it's a marvel.  However, I did have long loading times for the load zones as well as some freezes and only ONE crash.  My rig is not that bad before you say it.  It blows the first game's visuals and animations out of the water.  The shooting is about the same, not all that amazing.  It's hitscanning with a side of super beefy tank and flying enemies that WILL kill you if you aren't careful...or even if you are.  Not saying that this game is hard or anything, it definitely isn't.  You do feel better to play in this game than the first game.
I loved the music, I was surprised.  Typically with shooters and the more modern shooters, the music doesn't really stick with me.  The first game's music was...alright.  There were some standouts, but I liked quite a few tracks from this game.
Story wise...it has nothing to do with the first game.  You could just flat out skip playing the first game if you are only interested in this one.  There's a few characters other than yourself that make a second appearance...but they barely resemble themselves.

I see why people love Alyx Vance so far.  She's a treasure and a snack.  I bet she's even better in the expansions, which I'll get to eventually.

Yeah, I recommend it.  It's not this amazing epic or the best game ever.  Hell, there are things here that this game did that degraded future shooters(such as bogging you down in a room and spouting exposition).  However, I still don't understand why Half-Life 3 was not made.  Yes, I am aware of the VR game that is currently coming, but...seriously?  They didn't follow this up.  It's not like money, time, nor demand would be an issue.  Just saying Valve...

С"ка Брин... Был бы ты человеком!

You have no excuse not to play the first one anymore, now that Black Mase is out, so get that, and you'll immidiately want more once that's over. And there is definitely more to be had here. This is such a good game. Not just a shooter, but with such a breadth of mechanics and interesting gameplay. Just like in the previous game, the mechanics in the game don't just show up for one level to entertain you for a bit, before being forgotten, never to be used again. Nonono, every mechanic in this game is explored in all sorts of ways, and I'm constantly suprised at all the little games-within-the-game Valve has managed to create. Absolutely fantastic.

EDIT: I've now finished this and holy ****************. I am damn certain every mechanic in this game was utilized to it's fullest potential. This is incredible. Way beyond earning a spot in the Master List. Incredible. Just damn incredible.
